channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Trees hedges, 4th June
item.description:
I’ve driven up dog Lane and trees on both sides repeatedly knocked both door mirrors and scratched the near side. Hedges obviously weren’t cut back over winter
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dog Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole / road subsidence, 4th June
item.description:
Big crack in the road (suspect subsidence) which catches car tyres and guides them along.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge pothole near to kerb, 3rd June
item.description:
Getting quite deep now and dangerous, especially to cyclists
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham

item.title: Cars repeatedly blocking pavement, 2nd June
item.description:

item.title: Over hanging hedge/tree, 2nd June
item.description:

item.title: Blocked drains, 2nd June
item.description:
The drains on both side of the roads are blocked by mud resulting in water running down the carriageway and on to the busy A40. Currently the road is very wet and slippery, causing a serious risks to cyclists coming down the hill. If not resolved before the winter it will be lethal.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dowdeswell, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Barriers abandoned, 2nd June
item.description:
Plastic barriers abandoned along the pavement, left after work and not cleared
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honeybourne Way, St Paul’s, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trip hazard lump caused by tree roots, 2nd June
item.description:
The pavement is splitting over this lump now, but actually it stands about 3 inches proud of the surface so it’s clearly a trip hazard. Can someone come and have a look please

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41, Shakespeare Road, St Mark's, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public bench in Royal well broken and dangerous, 2nd June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Royal Well Bus Station, Montpellier, Cheltenham

item.title: Flytipping, 1st June

item.title: Previous repairs failing, 1st June
item.description:
This pothole has been repaired at least twice in recent months but is again failing due to inadequate repairs. It requires another visit to be rectified. Why can't these potholes be fixed properly on the first visit?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 145, Hewlett Road, Whaddon, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Speed signs, 1st June
item.description:
The speeding cars and vans along this residential road (Carlton street) could do with reminding to slow down, preferably to 20 miles per hour (speed bumps would be great too). It’s only a matter of time before the regular near misses with cyclists, cars and pedestrians become disastrous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 52, Carlton Street, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes and sinkholes, 1st June
item.description:
These multiple potholes and sinkholes along Carlton street continue to get worse and more dangerous for cars and cyclists.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 52, Carlton Street, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 potholes adjacent to island crossing point westbound A40, 31st May
item.description:
Two potholes worsening and difficult to avoid hitting due to adjacent island.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
